channel.title: How do you make high-scores on your forum connect to a server?
channel.description:
does anybody know how to make highscores on your forum connect to your server, i currently installed my highscores with my web-host but dont know how to make the high-scores connect to my server to pick up the information,
anybody know how?
the only part i dont know is the mysql part.

item.title: How do you make high-scores on your forum connect to a server?

item.description:
@si_force wrote:

nice site =p,i’ll use it though,for common sense.

Read full topic

item.title: How do you make high-scores on your forum connect to a server?
item.dc:creator: @ThatOneServer Mike_
item.description:
@ThatOneServer wrote:

mysql has nothing to do with php or html as much as text files have to do with java.

First you have to have your java store the hiscores stuff in mysql, then you have to have php read it. Theres no simpler way to put it. I found a site that will teach you how.

Read full topic
item.source: How do you make high-scores on your forum connect to a server?

item.title: How do you make high-scores on your forum connect to a server?
item.dc:creator: @si_force Si Force
item.description:
@si_force wrote:

i knew it was a way of storing data,but i never learned mysql language before.
thats why i’m stuck, i can do html ok though.

Read full topic
item.source: How do you make high-scores on your forum connect to a server?

item.title: How do you make high-scores on your forum connect to a server?
item.dc:creator: @ThatOneServer Mike_
item.description:
@ThatOneServer wrote:

Mysql is hardly a language. Its a way to store data. Another example of things that store data:
XML, configuration files(ini), SQL.
The “code” is just how you retrieve and insert data.

Read full topic
